leonid.util

Class FileUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • leonid.util.FileUtils

  • public class FileUtils
extends Object
    Useful file utilities to list files by specifying a path, which contains glob expression. JDK java.nio.file.Files utility class has a lot of useful file utilities. java.nio.file.FileSystem.getPathMatcher method returns a path matcher, which supports glob and regex expressions in the path. java.nio.file.Files.walkFileTree method does a great job to traverse directory tree.

    Only one small thing is not present, that is having the support of getting base directory for walking file tree with java.nio.file.Files.walkFileTree and pattern part from specified single path. Let's say you would like to print files in the following directory not caring of the direction of the slash (file separator):

    usr\**\*.xml

    To achieve it you invoke java.nio.file.Files.walkFileTree method passing base directory usr and implement path matching in java.nio.file.FileVisitor by getting path matcher java.nio.file.FileSystem.getPathMatcher. It's very useful to have utility, which splits any path into base directory and the pattern.

    This class contain utility methods to list files by specifying the path as absolute or relative, which may contain glob pattern. Having glob pattern in your path means that you may use the following wild cards:

    • The * character matches zero or more characters of a name component without crossing directory boundaries.
    • The ** characters matches zero or more characters crossing directory boundaries.
    • The ? character matches exactly one character of a name component.
    • The backslash character (\) is used to escape characters that would otherwise be interpreted as special characters. The expression \\ matches a single backslash and "\{" matches a left brace for example.
    • The [ ] characters are a bracket expression that match a single character of a name component out of a set of characters. For example, [abc]matches "a", "b", or "c". The hyphen (-) may be used to specify a range so [a-z] specifies a range that matches from "a" to "z"(inclusive). These forms can be mixed so [abce-g] matches "a", "b", "c", "e", "f" or "g". If the character after the [ is a ! then it is used for negation so [!a-c] matches any character except "a", "b", or "c". Within a bracket expression the *, ? and \ characters match themselves. The (-) character matches itself if it is the first character within the brackets, or the first character after the ! if negating.
    • The { } characters are a group of subpatterns, where the group matches if any subpattern in the group matches. The "," character is used to separate the subpatterns. Groups cannot be nested.

      For example, ../../{d?v,*bin} will return /bin, /dev, /sbin

    Author:
    Leonid Bazhenov
    See Also:
    Files.walkFileTree(Path, Set, int, FileVisitor)

      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  FileUtils.FileFilter
      This interface can be used by caller of listFiles to filter files further.
      protected static class  FileUtils.ListFileVisitor
      Implementation of FileVisitor to build the list of files based on the glob expression of the file path.
      static class  FileUtils.WildcardPath
      This is container class for keeping two parts of the path: base directory and wild card portion.

    • Method Detail

      • splitPathToBaseDirAndWildcard

        public static FileUtils.WildcardPath splitPathToBaseDirAndWildcard(String pathStr)
        Splits the path into base directory as absolute path and wild card. WildcardPath.baseDir is always absolute and normalized path.
        Parameters:
        pathStr - is path string, which will be parsed to get base directory and wild card. If it's null or empty string then current directory is assumed.
        Returns:
        WildcardPath object, which contains base directory as absolute path and wild card as a string.
        See Also:
        listFiles(String, Set, FileFilter)

      • listFiles

        public static List<Path> listFiles(String startPath)
                            throws IOException
        Returns the list of files as Path objects. startPath is a path to directory or actual file, which may contain wild card in glob syntax.

        Internally it invokes java.nio.file.Files.walkFileTree.

        Parameters:
        startPath - is the path, which may contain wild card in glob syntax.
        Returns:
        list of files.
        Throws:
        IOException - if startPath does not point to a real file or directory in the system.
        See Also:
        listFiles(String, Set, FileFilter)

      • listFiles

        public static List<Path> listFiles(String startPath,
                   Set<FileVisitOption> options)
                            throws IOException
        Returns the list of files as Path objects. startPath is a path to directory or actual file, which may contain wild card in glob syntax.

        Internally it invokes java.nio.file.Files.walkFileTree.

        Parameters:
        startPath - is the path, which may contain wild card in glob syntax.
        options - is a set of FileVisitOption or null if file system links are not supposed to be followed.
        Returns:
        list of files.
        Throws:
        IOException - if startPath does not point to a real file or directory in the system.
        See Also:
        listFiles(String, Set, FileFilter)

      • listFiles

        public static List<Path> listFiles(String startPath,
                   Set<FileVisitOption> options,
                   FileUtils.FileFilter fileFilter)
                            throws IOException
        Returns the list of files as Path objects. startPath is a path to directory or actual file, which may contain wild card in glob syntax. Final list of files, which satisfy glob expression can be filtered further if fileFilter is not null.

        Internally it invokes java.nio.file.Files.walkFileTree.

        Parameters:
        startPath - is the path, which may contain wild card in glob syntax.
        options - is a set of FileVisitOption or null if file system links are not supposed to be followed.
        fileFilter - is reference to an object, which does further filtering of files, which were matched the glob expression of startPath.
        Returns:
        list of files.
        Throws:
        IOException - if startPath does not point to a real file or directory in the system.

      • walkFileTree

        public static Path walkFileTree(String startPath,
                FileVisitor<? super Path> visitor)
                         throws IOException
        Walks a file tree from the startPath, which is a path to directory or actual file, which may contain wild card in glob syntax. Provided visitor is invoked only for matched files. Symbolic links are not followed.

        NOTE that:

        • Unlike java.nio.file.Files.walkFileTree it excepts start path not as a base directory to start scanning, but as a path with wild card.
        • It does not have max depth input parameter, since it may be indirectly specified by * and ** directory wild cards.
        • visitor is invoked only for matched files.

        Internally it invokes java.nio.file.Files.walkFileTree.

        Parameters:
        startPath - is the path, which may contain wild card in glob syntax.
        visitor - is the file visitor to invoke for each file, which matches the wild card glob pattern in startPath.
        Returns:
        the starting file.
        Throws:
        IOException
        See Also:
        walkFileTree(String, Set, FileVisitor)

      • walkFileTree

        public static Path walkFileTree(String startPath,
                Set<FileVisitOption> options,
                FileVisitor<? super Path> visitor)
                         throws IOException
        Walks a file tree from the startPath, which is a path to directory or actual file, which may contain wild card in glob syntax. Provided visitor is invoked only for matched files.

        NOTE that:

        • Unlike java.nio.file.Files.walkFileTree it excepts start path not as a base directory to start scanning, but as a path with wild card.
        • It does not have max depth input parameter, since it may be indirectly specified by * and ** directory wild cards.
        • visitor is invoked only for matched files.

        Internally it invokes java.nio.file.Files.walkFileTree.

        Parameters:
        startPath - is the path, which may contain wild card in glob syntax.
        options - is a set of FileVisitOption or null if file system links are not supposed to be followed.
        visitor - is the file visitor to invoke for each file, which matches the wild card glob pattern in startPath.
        Returns:
        the starting file.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • doListFiles

        protected static Path doListFiles(List<Path> fileList,
               String startPath,
               Set<FileVisitOption> options,
               FileVisitor<? super Path> visitor,
               FileUtils.FileFilter fileFilter)
                           throws IOException
        Helper method to walk file tree.
        Parameters:
        fileList - is the list of files to collect if it's not null.
        startPath - is the path, which may contain wild card in glob syntax.
        options - is a set of FileVisitOption or null if file system links are not supposed to be followed.
        visitor - is the file visitor to invoke for each file, which matches the wild card glob pattern in startPath.
        fileFilter - is reference to an object, which does further filtering of files, which were matched the glob expression of startPath.
        Returns:
        the starting file.
        Throws:
        IOException
